DataElement.preferredName: Nicotine Other Product Current Weekly Temporal Frequency Use Unit Range
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Reference to an individual's current weekly use of nicotine or tobacco products beyond those previously identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nicotine Other Product Current Weekly Temporal Frequency Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to an individual's use of nicotine or tobacco products beyond those previously identified._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._Every week. (NCI)_The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.__The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A plant alkaloid, found in the tobacco plant, and addictive central nervous system (CNS) stimulant that causes either ganglionic stimulation in low doses or ganglionic blockage in high doses. Nicotine acts as an agonist at the nicotinic cholinergic receptors in the autonomic ganglia, at neuromuscular junctions, and in the adrenal medulla and the brain. Nicotine's CNS-stimulating activities may be mediated through the release of several neurotransmitters, including acetylcholine, beta-endorphin, dopamine, norepinephrine, serotonin, and ACTH. As a result, peripheral vasoconstriction, tachycardia, and elevated blood pressure may be observed with nicotine intake. This agent may also stimulate the chemoreceptor trigger zone, thereby inducing nausea and vomiting.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.

Concepts.definition: A plant alkaloid, found in the tobacco plant, and addictive central nervous system (CNS) stimulant that causes either ganglionic stimulation in low doses or ganglionic blockage in high doses. Nicotine acts as an agonist at the nicotinic cholinergic receptors in the autonomic ganglia, at neuromuscular junctions, and in the adrenal medulla and the brain. Nicotine's CNS-stimulating activities may be mediated through the release of several neurotransmitters, including acetylcholine, beta-endorphin, dopamine, norepinephrine, serotonin, and ACTH. As a result, peripheral vasoconstriction, tachycardia, and elevated blood pressure may be observed with nicotine intake. This agent may also stimulate the chemoreceptor trigger zone, thereby inducing nausea and vomiting.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
